job_details.Vacaturetitel: Machine Learning Engineer II - Recommendation Applications ML (Marketplace)
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
This role is based in Amsterdam. Booking.com's Marketplace Department turns travel goals into travel realities. Our purpose? To create frictionless experiences at each and every stage of the trip. From browsing to booking and beyond, our focus is on building the connected experiences which make journeys smoother, faster and more enjoyable. Think of us as travel matchmakers, ensuring seamless integration across our product verticals to effortlessly and intuitively connect traveler preferences and actions.

   The Recommendation Applications ML team is dedicated to enhancing the overall customer experience and user journey. The team's mission is to be the centralized hub for all machine learning (ML) recommendation initiatives, providing scalable, reusable, state-of-the-art ML models. These models aim to increase relevance and personalization, enabling customers to be context-aware and make quicker, more informed decisions. Our team supports the vision of making travelers feel understood and assisted in every step of the travel booking journey.

   In 2025, we are planning to focus on expanding and optimizing our recommendation systems, for example by improving personalization and leveraging GenAI to build fine-tuned models for more relevant recommendations.

   As a Machine Learning Engineer II, you will be responsible for developing production-grade Machine Learning systems, from models to features and pipelines. You will own the design and delivery of ML systems, from initial idea generation and collecting business requirements from product stakeholders to implementation. You will work closely together with the other Machine Learning Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers in the Intent Discovery track as well as with Data Engineers, Software Engineers and Product Managers., * Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines, accounting for reliability, scalability, real-time requirements, monitoring, and retraining.
     * Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices and using standard libraries. Choose the right technology or coding methodology and refactor and simplify code when necessary.
     * Take full ownership of services end-to-end by actively monitoring system health, performance, and business impact. Ensure the relevant service level objectives (SLOs) are met.
     * Combine innovation with reuse by abstracting ML/AI concepts from one application to a generalized framework, including leveraging published research, open-source technologies, and previously-developed products at Booking.
     * Be responsible for business-related data governance processes, technical implementation, and maintenance of data processing services and storage systems, as well as ML governance processes.
     * Evaluate possible architecture solutions considering business and technology requirements.
     * Contribute to the internal ML/AI community by sharing knowledge and participating in internal ML programs.
     * Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies and upskilling as needed.
job_details.full_text:
Machine Learning Engineer II - Recommendation Applications ML (Marketplace)

This role is based in Amsterdam. Booking.com's Marketplace Department turns travel goals into travel realities. Our purpose? To create frictionless experiences at each and every stage of the trip. From browsing to booking and beyond, our focus is on building the connected experiences which make journeys smoother, faster and more enjoyable. Think of us as travel matchmakers, ensuring seamless integration across our product verticals to effortlessly and intuitively connect traveler preferences and actions.

   The Recommendation Applications ML team is dedicated to enhancing the overall customer experience and user journey. The team's mission is to be the centralized hub for all machine learning (ML) recommendation initiatives, providing scalable, reusable, state-of-the-art ML models. These models aim to increase relevance and personalization, enabling customers to be context-aware and make quicker, more informed decisions. Our team supports the vision of making travelers feel understood and assisted in every step of the travel booking journey.

   In 2025, we are planning to focus on expanding and optimizing our recommendation systems, for example by improving personalization and leveraging GenAI to build fine-tuned models for more relevant recommendations.

   As a Machine Learning Engineer II, you will be responsible for developing production-grade Machine Learning systems, from models to features and pipelines. You will own the design and delivery of ML systems, from initial idea generation and collecting business requirements from product stakeholders to implementation. You will work closely together with the other Machine Learning Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers in the Intent Discovery track as well as with Data Engineers, Software Engineers and Product Managers., * Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines, accounting for reliability, scalability, real-time requirements, monitoring, and retraining.
     * Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices and using standard libraries. Choose the right technology or coding methodology and refactor and simplify code when necessary.
     * Take full ownership of services end-to-end by actively monitoring system health, performance, and business impact. Ensure the relevant service level objectives (SLOs) are met.
     * Combine innovation with reuse by abstracting ML/AI concepts from one application to a generalized framework, including leveraging published research, open-source technologies, and previously-developed products at Booking.
     * Be responsible for business-related data governance processes, technical implementation, and maintenance of data processing services and storage systems, as well as ML governance processes.
     * Evaluate possible architecture solutions considering business and technology requirements.
     * Contribute to the internal ML/AI community by sharing knowledge and participating in internal ML programs.
     * Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies and upskilling as needed.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes the development and productionization of machine learning systems, including models, features, and pipelines. It highlights core ML Engineer responsibilities such as algorithm development, data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and MLOps. While GenAI is mentioned for future focus, the primary responsibilities and evidence point towards a traditional ML Engineer role focused on recommendation systems.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Be responsible for business-related data governance processes, technical implementation, and maintenance of data processing services and storage systems' directly relates to managing data infrastructure and pipelines.
job_tasks.phrase: Be responsible for business-related data governance processes, technical implementation, and maintenance of data processing services and storage systems

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'leveraging GenAI to build fine-tuned models for more relevant recommendations' and 'developing production-grade Machine Learning systems, from models to features and pipelines' indicates core modeling activities.
job_tasks.phrase: leveraging GenAI to build fine-tuned models for more relevant recommendations

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines' encompasses the creation and deployment of ML models.
job_tasks.phrase: Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines

job_tasks.justification: The responsibility to 'Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices and using standard libraries' and 'Choose the right technology or coding methodology' points to software development practices.
job_tasks.phrase: Build readable and reusable code, applying code quality best practices and using standard libraries

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Combine innovation with reuse by abstracting ML/AI concepts from one application to a generalized framework' suggests building software components and frameworks.
job_tasks.phrase: abstracting ML/AI concepts from one application to a generalized framework

job_tasks.justification: The statement 'Develop production-grade ML systems, from models to features and pipelines, accounting for reliability, scalability, real-time requirements, monitoring, and retraining' covers key MLOps aspects.
job_tasks.phrase: accounting for reliability, scalability, real-time requirements, monitoring, and retraining

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Take full ownership of services end-to-end by actively monitoring system health, performance, and business impact. Ensure the relevant service level objectives (SLOs) are met' directly relates to production system monitoring and maintenance.
job_tasks.phrase: actively monitoring system health, performance, and business impact

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'ML governance processes' falls under the operational aspects of managing ML systems.

The responsibility to 'collecting business requirements from product stakeholders' and 'Evaluate possible architecture solutions considering business and technology requirements' shows an understanding of business needs.
job_tasks.phrase: collecting business requirements from product stakeholders

Choose the right technology or coding methodology
Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies and upskilling as needed
work closely together with the other Machine Learning Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers... as well as with Data Engineers, Software Engineers and Product Managers
